definition: To actively seek out or visit a specific place or person, often with the intention of obtaining information, assistance, or guidance. It is commonly used when referring to the act of searching for professional advice, medical help, or expert opinions.

examples.english: I have to visit the doctor.
He wants to visit his friend.
We have to go to the town hall.

examples.german: Die Polizei wird den Tatort aufsuchen.
examples.english: The police will visit the crime scene.
